musicalLanguage.description: The quintessential piano song in 3/4 waltz time. Billy Joel's signature piece uses a bouncing waltz pattern that propels the storytelling forward. This arrangement covers the verse section with its classic C-G-F-C movement and the characteristic oom-pah-pah left hand.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse (8 bars in 3/4) — C-G/B-F/A-C waltz pattern with melodic development
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: C major waltz — the iconic 'oom-pah-pah' pattern establishes the bar-room feel
Bars 3-4: F to G — the melody climbs, building narrative momentum
Bars 7-8: Am to G to C — the verse resolution with a satisfying cadence
teachingGoals: Playing in 3/4 time — feeling three beats per measure
Left-hand waltz pattern: bass note followed by two chord tones
Coordinating a lyrical melody over a rhythmic accompaniment
styleTips: Emphasize beat 1 in the left hand — the 'oom' should be slightly louder than the 'pah-pah'
Right hand sings the melody above the waltz — think of it as a vocalist over a piano bar trio
Keep a steady, swaying tempo — this is dance music at heart

measures.teachingNote: C major waltz begins — bass on 1, chord on 2-3. The right hand melody starts simply.
G major — the melody climbs C-D-E. Notice the bass walks down from C to G.
F major — melody peaks at F4 then descends. The waltz is in full swing now.
Back to C — hold the melody note for the full bar. A moment to breathe.
A minor — the mood shifts slightly darker. The melody pushes upward.
G major — melody arches up to G4 then descends. Building toward the phrase ending.
F major — a gentle melodic oscillation before the final resolution.
G to C implied — the phrase ends on C, ready to cycle back. The waltz never really stops.
